text: Somapura Mahavihara (Sanskrit; Shompur MÃ´habihar) in Paharpur, Badalgachhi Upazila, Naogaon District, Bangladesh is among the best known Buddhist viharas in the Indian subcontinent. It is one of the most important archaeological sites in the country. It was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1985. Category:Buildings and structures in Bangladesh Category:Buddhist buildings Category:World Heritage Sites in Asia Category:8th-century buildings and structures
title: Somapura Mahavihara
